products.title: HP 2310m
products.description:
The HP 2310m is a mid-range 23" high definition LCD monitor and is very similar to the 21.5" HP 2210m. The only things really setting the 2310m apart from the 2210m other than screen size are the 2310m's wider 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio and 3ms gray-to-gray response time. Otherwise, the 2310m shares the same 1920 x 1080 native resolution and input selection (VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and HDMI).

The 2310m's 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio allows for brighter whites and darker blacks for a richer HD experience while its 1920 x 1080 resolution allows for full 1080p HD video support. Its 3ms gray-to-gray response time reduces blurring and ghosting in fast action scenes, making it suitable for gaming. Additionally, the 2310m's HDMI input is capable of handling audio as well as video, making ideal for the 2310m's integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers.

Features

  • VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and HDMI inputs
  • 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio
  • 23" diagonal screen size; 1920 x 1080 HD-ready resolution and 16:9 aspect ratio
  • 3ms gray-to-gray response time
  • Integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers
  • Standard 4-hole VESA wall-mount pattern 
  • Typical brightness: 300 nits

pros.text: dual digital inputs - DVI and HDMI
16:9 aspect ratio is ideal for new HD media
attractive stand design
HDMI, DVI, and VGA inputs!
full 1080p
Beautiful, detailed pictures for movies, games and computing applications!
At 23 inches, it is the perfect size screen for 1080p.
VESA mount
2.5 Ms gray-to-gray response time...  according to the marketing label on the screen.
Built in speakers are better than one would expect!

cons.text: stand provides no height adjustment
Marketing sticker on top bezel will leave residue if pulled off, although orangish liquid Goo Gone can remove any left on residue.
Monitor buzzes
TN based display - poor colour accuracy and viewing angles
16:9 aspect ratio is inferior to the older 16:10 for most computer interaction, loss of ~200 vertical pixels
glossy display and bezel

related.title: HP 2010i
related.description:
The HP 2010i is a mid-range 20" high definition LCD monitor with Energy Star certification. It has a dynamic contrast ratio of 15,000:1, a native resolution of 1600 X 900, a 16:9 aspect ratio and a 5ms response time for reduced blur. Its inbuilt 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers provide sound without the need for additional speakers. The HP 2010i sports VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and audio ports but no HDMI ports.

The 2010i's 15,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio allows for darker blacks and whiter whites, resulting in a cleaner picture. Its 5ms on/off response time ensures less blurring in fast action scenes. Its integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers provide the 2010i with native sound functionality but its lack of HDMI support makes using the 2010i's audio portn necessary for the speakers to work.

Features

  • VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and audio ports
  • 15,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio
  • 20" diagonal screen size; 1600 x 900 HD-ready resolution and 16:9 aspect ratio
  • 5ms on/off response time
  • Integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers
  • Standard 4-hole VESA wall-mount pattern 
  • Energy Star certification

pros.text: space-saving stand - allows users to tuck away their keyboard
matte panel - doesn't reflect overhead lighting - good for office environments

cons.text: included stand lacks height adjustment
poor sounding, underpowered 2 watt speakers
inadequate vertical viewing angle - not very functional in portrait mode
sticker on the top bezel leaves a sticky glue residue when removed
glossy bezel - easily shows fingerprints and attracts dust

related.title: HP 2210m
related.description:
The HP 2210m is a mid-range 21.5" high definition LCD monitor and is very similar to the 20" HP 2010i. However, the 2210m sports a number of improvements over the 2010i, such as: 1920 x 1080 native resolution, a 40,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio, a 2.5ms typical response time and an HDMI port. The 2210m also does not boast the Energy Star certification that the 2010i does.

Its 1920 x 1080 native resolution means that the 2210m can produce full 1080p HD picture quality while its 40,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio ensures that whites are brighter and blacks are darker for a more faithful image reproduction. The 2210m's 2.5ms typical response time allows it to handle fast action scenes with less blurring and ghosting. Additionally, the 2210m's HDMI port can handle video and sound for the 2210m's integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers.

Features

 

  • VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and HDMI inputs
  • 40,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio
  • 21.5" diagonal screen size; 1920 x 1080 HD-ready resolution and 16:9 aspect ratio
  • 2.5ms typical response time
  • Integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers
  • Standard 4-hole VESA wall-mount pattern 
  • Typical brightness: 300 nits

pros.text: HD images show sharp and clear with no distortions
very bright display, visible in a wide variety of lighting conditions
bright and dark contrast are clear
wide variety of resolutions supported
a number of input types available
setup and installation is fast and intuitive
menus are well laid out and easy to navigate
easily tilted to suit the user's desk and chair layout

cons.text: audio through standard ports is poor quality

related.title: HP 2710m
related.description:
The HP 2710m is a mid-range 27" high definition monitor with many similarities to the 23" HP 2310m. Besides its larger screen, the HP 2710m sports a few improvements over the 2310m, namely: a 92% color gamut, 400 nits brightness and a 2.5 ms gray-to-gray response time. Otherwise, the 2710 sports the same 1920 x 1080 native resolution, 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio and 16:9 aspect ratio as the HP 2310m.

The 2710m's 92% color gamut provides deeper and truer colour reproduction while its 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio allows for darker blacks and brighter whites. Its 2.5 ms gray-to-gray response time allows the 2710m to reproduce fast action scenes with less blurring and ghosting, making it more suitable for gaming. Of course its 1920 x 1080 native resolution means the 2710m is full 1080p HD capable.

Features

  • VGA, DVI-D (with HDCP) and HDMI inputs
  • 60,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio
  • 27" diagonal screen size; 1920 x 1080 HD-ready resolution and 16:9 aspect ratio
  • 2.5ms gray-to-gray response time
  • Integrated 2-watt HP Power Sound speakers
  • Standard 4-hole VESA wall-mount pattern 
  • Typical brightness: 400 nits

pros.text: glossy screen allows colors to pop, very vibrant
text is clear and easy to read from a normal viewing distance
black levels are very good, contrast is well rendered
affordable price point for a 27" display
stand is sturdy and doesn't wobble
full 1080p resolution (1920 x 1080px)
larger dot pitch - displays the same detail as a 22-24" display on a larger 27" one, great for people who don't like to strain their eyes or fool around with DPI settings
dual digital inputs - DVI and HDMI
fast moving graphics update quickly, response time is good

cons.text: prone to glare and reflection of light sources in the room
limited viewing angle, need to be right in front
black levels stay the same regardless of brightness setting\
Dynamic Contrast setting can create blindingly bright scenes
1080p resolution is somewhat small for the 27" display size, more standard on 22-24" displays - less detailed looking (larger dot pitch)
TN panel - poor colour quality and viewing angles compared to IPS based displays

skus.title: Bundle Of Two HP 2310m 23 Diagonal Full Hd Widescreen LCD Monitors
